intro: Centaurea alba subsp. alba, commonly known as the white knapweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped. It produces small, fluffy white flowers arranged in a composite head, which are often surrounded by pale blue or purple bracts. This species thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed areas.
